location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letters from Sir Henry Bartle Edward Frere, and other members of the Frere family

physicalDescription.extent: The correspondence has been arranged in chronological order according to date, with undated items being placed at the rear of the file.

This file has a foliation number in the top right hand corner of the recto of each folio with a pencil number enclosed in a circle. Some of the folios have been renumbered, and the numbers no longer in use have been crossed through with a pencil line.

mods.abstract: Correspondence to Lewis Pelly from Sir Bartle Frere, his wife Lady Catherine Frere, his niece Constance Eliza Frere and his brother William Edward Frere.The correspondence with Sir Bartle Frere primarily discusses matters in India, the Gulf and Tehran and includes discussions on telegraphs, military forces and explorations of central Asia.Lady Catherine's correspondence focuses on family matters and provides news of their five children, the family's health, travel arrangements and occasional updates from the British press including the reporting of the murder of the Calcutta Judge John Norman Paxton.The correspondence from William Edward Frere primarily concerns Frere's work in Mauritius and Sir Bartle Frere and Pelly's anti-slavery mission to Zanzibar and Muscat.
